errors.rule: Voices stay within their respective ranges.
notes: The bass range spans F2 to D4.
The tenor range spans C3 to A4.
The alto range spans F3 to D5.
The soprano range spans C4 to A5.

errors.rule: Consecutive upper voices are within an octave.
notes: The bass is not a part of this rule nor any reference to upper voices.

errors.rule: Voices do not cross each other.
notes: A lower voice is not higher than a higher voice in the same chord.

errors.rule: Roman numerals are of the correct mode.
notes: The capitalization of each roman numeral analysis pertains to whether the key is major or minor.

errors.rule: Arabic numerals are valid.
notes: Arabic numerals are either missing or read 5/3, 7, 6/3, 6, 6/5, 6/4, 4/3, or 4/2.

errors.rule: All tones are chordal.
Bass notes match the note expected given their respective analyses.
The roots of chords are not missing.
The thirds of chords are not missing.
The fifths are not missing in chords that are not in root position.
The sevenths of seventh chords are not missing.
There are not two leading tones within a chord.
The sevenths of chords are not doubled.
The fifths of 6/4 chords are not doubled.
The progression begins with a tonic chord.
The progression ends on a tonic chord.
V chords do not resolve to IV chords.
A 6/4 chord is a cadential, passing, or neighbor 6/4.
The final cadence is permitted.
notes: The penultimate chord is either IV or V, thus respectively part of a plagal cadence or an authentic cadence.

errors.rule: Common tones are held.
notes: At least one note of each pitch class is held on a voice.
This does not apply between chords of the same type (e.g. V - V).

errors.rule: Voices do not leap.
notes: A leap is any motion of distance greater than a third.

errors.rule: There are no parallel fifths.
There are parallel octaves.
A d5 to P5 is within the upper voices.
An ascending d5 to P5 is in passing between an I chord and an I6 chord.
The soprano voice moves stepwise at a hidden fifth.
The soprano voice moves stepwise at a hidden octave.
Voices do not overlap.
notes: A lower voice does not move to a note higher than the previous note of a higher voice.
A higher voice does not move to a note lower than the previous note of a lower voice.

errors.rule: Leading tones are resolved.
notes: Leading tones resolve a halfstep up to the tonic.
In a I7 chord, the seventh does not function as a leading tone, and it resolves down like all sevenths.

errors.rule: The sevenths of seventh chords are resolved.
notes: The sevenths of seventh chords resolve a step down.

errors.rule: Voices do not leap by augmented seconds.
Voices do not leap by tritones.
